tuv.seg: Working in the EU
Ag obair san AE
• EU Directives on free movement of workers
• Treoracha de chuid an AE maidir le saorghluaiseacht oibrithe
As a European Union (EU) citizen, you have the right to live and work in any other EU country
Mar shaoránach den Aontais Eorpaigh (AE), tá sé de cheart agat maireachtáil agus oibriú in aon cheann de thíortha an AE

If you are an EU national or a dependant of such a national and you meet the requirements of the EU Directives on free movement of workers, you may not, in general, be refused permission to land in another EU country

Más saoránach den AE thú nó cleithiúnach saoránaigh agus má shásaíonn tú riachtanais Treoracha an AE maidir le saorthaisteal oibrithe, ní féidir, go ginearálta, diúltú duit dul i dtír in aon tír eile den AE
You may require a valid identity card or passport
Beidh cárta aitheantais bhailí nó pas ag teastáil uait
You may be refused entry and/or your right of residence in another member state may be restricted on grounds of public policy, public security, or public health
Féadfar a dhiúltú duit dul isteach i mballstát eile nó féadfar do cheart cónaithe i mballstát eile a dhiúltú duit ar fhorais beartais phoiblí, slándáil an phobail nó sláinte an phobail
The rights outlined in this section broadly apply to the non-EU States in the European Economic Area, that is, Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein, as well as to Switzerland

Tá na cearta a dtugtar sracléiriú orthu sa roinn seo infheidhme go ginearálta maidir leis na Ballstáit neamh-AE de chuid an Limistéir Eorpaigh Eacnamaíoch, is é sin, an Iorua, an Íoslann agus Lichtinstéin, chomh maith leis an Eilvéis
EU Directives on free movement of workers
Treoracha de chuid an AE maidir le saorghluaiseacht oibrithe
If you are an EU national moving to another EU country to take up employment or self-employment or to provide a service, the Directives cover you
Más náisiúnach de chuid an AE tú atá ag aistriú go dtí tír eile de chuid an AE chun dul i mbun fostaíochta nó féinfhostaíochta nó chun seirbhís a sholáthar, tagann tú faoi chumhdach na dTreoracha
Members of your family, whatever their nationality, have the right to accompany you or to join you in your country of employment
Tá an ceart ag daoine de do theaghlach, cibé náisiúntacht atá acu, dul in éineacht leat nó dul amach chugat i dtír d’fhostaíochta

Your family is defined as your spouse and your children who are under 21 years of age (or older if they are dependent on you) and their spouses, as well as your parents and your parents-in-law, if they are dependent on you

Is é an míniú a thugtar ar do theaghlach ná do chéile agus do leanaí atá faoi bhun 21 bliain d’aois (nó níos sine más cleithiúnaithe de do chuidse iad) agus a gcéilí, mar aon le do thuismitheoirí agus tuismitheoirí do chéile, más cleithiúnaithe de do chuidse iad
Your registered partner (and dependent relatives) is also entitled to move with you if the host member state treats registered partnerships as equivalent to marriage

Tá do pháirtí cláraithe (agus gaolta cleithiúnacha) i dteideal freisin aistriú in éineacht leat má dhéileálann an ballstát is óstach le comhpháirtíochtaí cláraithe mar chomhpháirtíocht atá coibhéiseach leis an bpósadh

The host member state must facilitate the entry and residence of other family members who do not have an absolute right to move but who are dependent on you or whose health is such that they require care by you

Ní mór don bhallstát is óstach teacht isteach agus cónaí daoine eile den teaghlach, nach bhfuil láncheart acu aistriú ach atá ina gcleithiúnaithe de do chuidse nó go dteastaíonn do chúram uathu mar gheall ar a sláinte, a éascú
Member states must also facilitate the entry and resident the entry and residence of a partner with whom you have a durable relationship
Ní mór do bhallstáit dul isteach agus cónaí páirtí lena bhfuil caidreamh buanseasmhach agat a éascú freisin
EU citizens exercising their right to free movement are not required to have a residence card but their family members who are not themselves EU citizens may be required to have such a card

Ní cheanglaítear ar shaoránaigh de chuid an AE a fheidhmíonn an ceart atá acu chun saorghluaiseachta cárta cónaithe a bheith acu ach féadfar a cheangal ar dhaoine dá dteaghlaigh nach saoránaigh de chuid an AE iad féin cárta den sórt sin a bheith acu
If they wish to, your spouse, civil partner and children also have the right to work without restriction in your country of employment
Más mian leo é, tá an ceart ag do chéile, do pháirtnéir sibhialta agus do leanaí dul i mbun oibre gan srianadh i dtír d’fhostaíochta
You and your family members have the right to the same social benefits as the nationals of the host member state
Tá an ceart agat agus ag na daoine de do theaghlach chun na sochar sóisialach céanna atá ag náisiúnaigh de chuid an bhallstáit is óstach
This includes the right to education access and benefits
Folaíonn sin an ceart chun rochtain ar oideachas agus chun sochar
Members of your family who come from a non-EU country may be asked for an entry visa by the country of employment
Féadfaidh tír na fostaíochta víosa iontrála a iarraidh ar dhaoine de do theaghlach as tír neamh-AE
This visa is granted quite easily and should be free of charge
Deonaítear an víosa sin go héasca agus ba chóir go mbeidh sé saor in aisce
You are entitled to be recruited under the same conditions as nationals of the country in which you are seeking work and cannot be asked to meet any additional requirements
Tá sé de cheart agat post a fháil faoi na coinníollacha céanna a bhaineann le saoránaigh den tír ina bhfuil tú ag lorg oibre inti agus ní féidir le fostóir aon riachtanais bhreise a éileamh ort
This means that you can apply for any job vacancy advertised in any EU country, including public sector jobs
Mar sin is féidir leat iarratas a dhéanamh ar aon phost fógraithe in aon tír san AE, postanna sa rannóg phoiblí san áireamh

However, certain public service posts may be restricted to nationals of a particular country where the job in question involves safeguarding public order or the interests of the state, for example, the armed forces and police

Ach, d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh postanna faoi leith sa tseirbhís phoiblí teoranta chuig saoránaigh den tír ina bhfuileadar má tá cúram ord poiblí nó spéiseanna eile den stát, mar shampla, na forsaí cosanta agus na poilíní i gceist
Recognition of qualifications in the EU
Aitheantas ar do chailíochtaí san AE
Some EU countries require diplomas, titles, certificates or other special qualifications as a condition for access to certain salaried and self-employed occupations

Bíonn cuid de na tíortha san AE ag iarraidh go mbeadh dioplómaí, teidil, teastais nó cáilíochtaí eile speisialta ag daoine mar riachtanas iontrála chuig slithe beatha tuarastail nó féin-fhostaithe faoi leith
It can be difficult to have your own training and skills fully recognised
Is minic go mbíonn deacrachtaí ann aitheantas iomlán a fháil ar an oiliúint agus ar na scileanna atá agat
The EU has therefore set up systems for recognising diplomas and training that enable you to make full use of your training and skills in another EU country

Tá córas curtha i bhfeidhm mar sin ag an AE le haitheantas a thabhairt do dioplómaí agus d'oiliúint a chuireann ar do chumas úsáid iomlán a bhaint as an oiliúint atá ort agus as do scileanna i dtír eile de chuid an AE
The basic principle is that if you are qualified to exercise a profession in your home country, you are qualified to exercise the same profession in any other EU country
Mar bhunphrionsabal má tá cáilíocht ort i slí bheatha i do thír féin tabharfar aitheantas duit an tslí bheatha sin a leanúint in aon tír eile de chuid an AE
A general system of recognition of qualifications that is applicable to most regulated professions has been put in place across the EU
Tá córas ginearálta maidir le aitheantas a thabhairt do cháilíochtaí proifisiúnta curtha i bhfeidhm ar fud an AE

So, if you wish to work in a profession (as a teacher, lawyer, engineer or psychologist, for example) that is regulated in the country of employment, you must apply for recognition of your qualifications in that country

Mar sin más mian leat dul ag obair i ngairm faoi leith (múinteoir, innealtóir, síceolaí, mar shampla) a bhfuil rialacha ag baint leis sa tír ina bhfuil tú le bheith fostaithe inti ní mór duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar aitheantas a fháil sa tír sin ar na cáilíochtaí atá agat
The authorities have 4 months in which to reply
Ní mór do na húdaráis scéal a chur chugat maidir le d'iarratas taobh istigh de cheithre mhí

If they consider that your training is significantly different in terms of duration or content from that given in the host country, you may be asked to obtain either additional professional experience completing your training, or to take a training course or to take an aptitude test

Má cheapann siad go bhfuil difríocht mhór idir an oiliúint a cuireadh ortsa i dtaobh fad agus ábhair ón oiliúint a cuirtear ar fáil sa tír sin, d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh ort taithí phroifisiúnta bhreise a fháil le cur leis an oiliúint, nó cúrsa traenála a dhéanamh nó fiú scrúdú mianaigh a dhéanamh
If you are a doctor, a general nurse, a dentist, a midwife, a vet, a pharmacist or an architect, your national qualifications are in principle recognised automatically
Más dochtúir, banaltra ghinearálta, fiaclóir, bean chabhartha, tréidlia, poitigéir nó ailtire thú is iondúil go dtugtar aitheantas ar an bpointe do do chuid cáilíochtaí
If your profession is not regulated in the country in which you wish to work, no recognition of your qualifications is required
Muna bhfuil rialacha faoi leith ag baint le do shlí bheatha sa tír ina bhfuil spéis agat oibriú inti, ní gá aitheantas ar do chuid cáilíochtaí a lorg
Looking for a job in the EU
Ag lorg fostaíochta san AE
The EURES network was established by the European Commission to help European citizens looking for work in another country in the EU/EEA
Bhunaigh Coimsiún na hEorpa an gréasán EURES le cabhrú le saoránaigh Eorpacha atá ar lorg oibre i dtír eile san AE/LEE

EURES has a network of advisers, known as EURES advisers, who can give you general practical information on legislation, social security, living conditions, useful addresses, information on pay levels, taxes, contracts, recruitment practices, etc

Tá gréasán de chomhairleoirí an EURES, ar a dtugtar comhairleoirí EURES, ar féidir leo eolas praicticiúil a thabhairt duit ar reachtaíocht, leas sóisialta, dálaí maireachtála, seoltaí úsáideacha, eolas ar leibhéil íocaíochta, chánacha, chonarthaí, nósanna earcaíochta, srl
They also have access to the EURES job vacancies database with vacancies in the EU/EEA
Tá rochtain acu fosta chuig bunachar sonraí folúntais oibre EURES le folúntais san AE /LEE
If you are interested in working or seeking work within the EU/EEA, make an appointment with your nearest EURES advisor
Más suim leat a bheith ag obair nó a bheith ar lorg oibre san AE/LEE, déan coinne le do chomhairleoir EURES is cóngaraí
Contact your nearest employment services office or Intreo centre for more information
Déan teagmháil le d' oifig seirbhísí fostaíochta nó ionad Intreo is congaraí chun tuilleadh eolais a fháil
You can access the EURES job vacancies database yourself from the EURES site
Is féidir leat dul isteach ar bhunachar sonraí folúntais oibre EURES tú féin ón láithreán EURES
Each vacancy in the database is provided with contact details at the bottom of the page
Bíonn sonraí teagmhála ann le gach folúntas sa bhunachar sonraí ar bhun an leathanaigh
If you are unemployed, you have the right to live in another EU country for a "reasonable period" of time in order to look for a job
Más duine dífhostaithe thú tá sé de cheart agat maireachtáil ar feadh "tréimhse réasúnta" i dtír eile den AE le deis a thabhairt duit post a fháil
In the absence of a definition of "reasonable period", most EU countries are now operating a 6-month period, though some EU countries are still operating a 3-month period

Muna bhfuil aon tréimhse faoi leith leagtha síos ag tír mar "thréimhse réasúnta" is iondúil gur tréimhse de shé mhí a chuireann tíortha den AE i bhfeidhm, cé go bhfuil cuid acu fós ag cur tréimhse de 3 mhí i bhfeidhm
You are advised to check the exact situation with the national authorities of the EU country in which you are looking for work
Is fearr an scéal a fhiosrú leis na húdaráis chuí sa tír ina bhfuil tú ag dul ag lorg oibre inti

However, no matter how long you have to look for a job, you cannot be asked to leave the country if you can prove that you are genuinely looking for a job and that you have a real chance of finding one

Ach, is cuma cén fhad a thugtar duit post a lorg ní féidir iarraidh ort an tír a fhágáil más féidir leat a chruthú go bhfuil tú i ndáiríre ag lorg fostaíochta agus go bhfuil seans mhaith ann go dtiocfaidh tú ar an bpost sin
For example, you have still got interviews or tests to attend
Mar shampla, d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh agallaimh nó scrúduithe socraithe agat le freastal orthu
You can register at employment agencies and centres without being resident in the country in which you wish to work and you will be given the same help to find work as nationals of that country

Is féidir leat clárú le heagraíochtaí agus le hionaid fhostaíochta i dtír fiú muna bhfuil cónaí agat inti más mian leat dul ag obair sa tír sin agus cuirfear an cúnamh céanna ar fáil duit agus a fhaigheann saoránaigh na tíre sin
Transferring your unemployment benefit
Ag aistriú sochair dífhostaíochta
If you are drawing unemployment benefit in one member state, you may continue to draw benefit from that same country for up to 13 weeks after you move to another member state
Má tá sochar dífhostaíochta dhá íoc leat i mballstát amháin, is féidir leanúint ort leis an sochar sin a fháil ón tír chéanna ar feadh 13 sheachtain tar éis duit imeacht chuig ballstát eile
This is provided that you have been available to the employment services in the country where you have been drawing unemployment benefit for at least 4 weeks
Íocfar an sochar ar an gcoinníoll go raibh tú ar fáil do na seirbhísí fostaíochta sa tír ina raibh tú ag fáil an tsochair ar feadh, ar a laghad, 4 sheachtain
If you apply to transfer your benefit it will be paid directly to you
Má iarrann tú do shochar a aistriú thar lear íocfar é leat go díreach
You will still be required to register with the employment services of the country where you have gone to look for work within a week
Ní mór duit clárú leis na seirbhísí fostaíochta sa tír ina bhfuil tú ar lorg oibre laistigh seachtain amháin
Also you may now transfer your benefit more than once while you are unemployed provided you do not exceed the maximum period of 13 weeks
Is féidir leat do shochar a aistriú níos mó ná uair amháin agus atá tú dífhostaithe freisin ar choinníoll nach dtéann tú thar an uasteorainn 13 seachtaine
If you do not find work, you must return to the first country within 3 months, otherwise you will lose your right to unemployment benefit
Mura n-éiríonn leat obair a fháil, ní mór duit taobh istigh de 3 mhí, filleadh ar an gcéad tír nó caillfidh tú an cead sochar dífhostaíochta a fháil
If you are leaving Ireland to move to Northern Ireland or Britain your Social Welfare Local Office will issue you with the Form U2 (formerly Form E303) which you take to the UK social services

Má tá tú ag fágáil Éireann chun bogadh go Tuaisceart Éireann nó an Bhreatain, eiseoidh d'Oifig Áitiúil Leasa Shóisialaigh Foirm U2 (Foirm E303 roimhe seo) duit chun é a thógáil go dtí na seirbhísí sóisialta RA
If you are moving to another EU country the Department of Social Protection will send the U2 form to your new address in that EU country
Má bhogann tú go tír eile san AE, seolfaidh an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí foirm U2 chuig do sheoladh nua sa tír AE
As an EU national working in another EU country you have the right to live there
Mar shaoránach de thír amháin den AE atá ag obair i dtír eile den AE tá sé de cheart agat maireachtáil sa tír sin
You are not required to have a residence permit
Níl ort ceadúnas cónaithe a fáil
You are subject to the same working conditions as nationals of the country you are working in as regards, for example, pay, dismissal, hours of work, maternity leave and health and safety at work

Baineann na coinníollacha oibre céanna leat agus a bhaineann le saoránaigh na tíre eile, maidir le, mar shampla, pá, briseadh ón bpost, uaireanta oibre, saoire mháthaireachais, sláinte/sábháilteachas sa láthair oibre
You are also subject to the same conditions as nationals of the host country with regard to the principles of equality between men and women
Baineann na rialacha céanna leat freisin agus a bhaineann le saoránaigh na tíre maidir le cothromaíocht idir fir agus mná
The basic aim of EU policy is to ensure that you are part of a social security system and that you do not lose your rights, regardless of the member state you decide to work in
Tá sé mar bhunaidhm ag polasaí an AE cinntiú go bhfuil tú clúdaithe ag córas sóisialach agus nach gcailleann tú do chearta, is cuma cén ballstát a roghnaíonn tú le dul ag obair ann
In principle, you are insured for social security purposes in the country you work in
Go bunúsach bíonn árachas sóisialta agat i bpé tír ina bhfuil tú ag obair inti
You, and in certain circumstances, your family are entitled to the same social security benefits as nationals of the country in which you work
Bíonn tú agus, i gcásanna áirid, do theaghlach, i dteideal na sochar céanna faoin gcóras árachais shóisialta agus atá saoránaigh na tíre ina bhfuil tú ag obair inti

These rights cover sickness and maternity benefits, disability, old-age and survivor's benefits, benefits payable for accidents at work, occupational illness, death and unemployment, as well as family allowances

Baineann na cearta seo le híocaíochtaí i gcás tinnis, máthaireachais, míchumais, seanaoise agus do mharthanóirí, sochair a íoctar tar éis timpiste ag an obair, tinneas ceirde, sochair bháis agus dífhostaíochta, chomh maith le liúntais teaghlaigh
You are required to pay the same level of contributions as host country nationals
Tá ort na ranníocaíochtaí céanna a íoc agus a íocann saoránaigh de chuid na tíre
You cannot be excluded from benefits on grounds of nationality, for reasons of residence, or for any other discriminatory reason
Ní féidir ar chúinsí náisiúntachta, ar chúiseanna a bhaineann le áit chónaithe, ná ar aon chúis leatroime eile diúltú sochair a íoc leat
You can find more information in our document, Leaving Ireland and your social security entitlements
Tá tuilleadh eolais ar fáil inár ndoiciméad, Do chearta leasa shóisialta agus tú ag fágáil Éireann
By working in another member state and by transferring your residence there, you are likely to become "resident for tax purposes" there
Trí bheith ag obair i mballstát eile agus trí aistriú ansin mar áit chónaithe, is dóigh go dtiocfaidh tú chun “cónaí chun críocha cánach” ann
The definition of fiscal residence varies from one member state to another
Athraíonn an míniú ar chónaí fioscach ó bhallstát amháin go ballstát eile
You must comply with the laws of the country where you have established your residence
Ní mór duit dlíthe na tíre inar bhunaigh tú d’áit chónaithe a chomhlíonadh
The laws on personal taxation vary considerably from one member state to another and you may be liable for taxation in more than one country
Athraíonn na dlíthe maidir le cánachas pearsanta go mór ó bhallstát amháin go ballstát eile agus féadfaidh tú a bheith faoi dhliteanas cánach i níos mó ná tír amháin
In general, you are subject to income tax in the country where you are living but this may not be the case if you are a “posted worker” – see below
Go ginearálta, tá tú faoi réir cánach sa tír ina bhfuil tú i do chónaí ach b’fhéidir nach amhlaidh a bheidh an cas más “oibrí atá curtha go dtí Ballstát eile” tú – féach thíos
In general, property is taxed in the country in which it is situated but, again, there are variations
Go ginearálta, gearrtar cáin ar mhaoin sa tír ina bhfuil sí suite ach, arís, tá éagsúlachtaí ann
Tax agreements have been concluded between most of the member states of the EU, which are intended to avoid double taxation, if you derive income from different countries
Tá comhaontaithe cánacha ann idir an cuid is mó den ballstáit an AE ar mhaithe le dliteanas cánach dúbailte a sheachaint, má bhíonn ioncam agat ó thíortha eagsúla
In general, national fiscal rules must respect the fundamental principle of non-discrimination against nationals of another EU country
Go ginearálta, ní mór do na rialacha fioscacha náisiúnta aitheantas a thabhairt don bhunphrionsabal i gcoinne leatroime ar shaoránaigh de thír eile den AE
Workers posted to another EU country
Oibrithe a sannadh chuig tír eile den AE
You have certain specific rights if you are a posted worker, that is, you work for a limited period of time in a member state other than the one where you normally work
Tá cearta faoi leith agat má sanntar chuig tír eile thú ag obair, sin le rá go n-oibríonn tú ar feadh tréimhse teoranta i mballstát eile seachas an ceann ina mbíonn tú ag obair ann de ghnáth
If you are to be posted for a period of more than a month, your employer must inform you in writing, before you leave, of your pay and working conditions while you are abroad

Más tréimhse de níos faide ná mí atá i gceist ní mór don fhostóir a chur in iúl duit i scríbhinn, roimh imeacht duit, cén pá agus coinníollacha oibre a bheidh agat an fhad agus a bhíonn tú ag obair thar lear
You will usually remain affiliated to the social security system of your country of origin
De ghnáth leanfaidh tú de bheith cleamhnaithe le córas slándála sóisialaí do thíre tionscnaimh
You may pay income tax in that country as well but the situation varies between member states
Ní mór duit cáin ioncaim a íoc sa tír sin chomh maith ach athraíonn cúrsaí idir na ballstáit
You can find out more about social security for posted workers in this guide or see 'further information’ below
Tá sonraí ar fáil faoi theidlíochtaí sláinte agus leasa shóisialta sa Tuilleadh eolais' thíos
Freedom to provide services
Saor le seirbhísí a chur ar fáil
You may choose to offer your services in another EU country without establishing yourself there permanently
D'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh tú ag iarraidh do chuid seirbhísí a chur ar fáil i dtír eile den AE ach nach mbeadh gnáthchónaí buan ort sa tír sin
If you comply with the rules of the profession or trade that apply in your own country, you can, in principle, offer those services anywhere else in the EU
Má shásaíonn tú na rialacha a bhaineann leis an ngairm nó ceird atá leagtha síos i do thír féin, is féidir leat, i bprionsabal, na seirbhísí sin a chur ar fáil in aon áit eile san AE
You can travel to assist clients located in another EU country or you can provide paid services from your country of residence without travelling there

Is féidir leat taisteal le cúnamh a thabhairt do chustaiméirí atá lonnaithe i dtír eile den AE nó is féidir leat seirbhísí a chur ar fáil ar íocaíocht ó do thír chónaithe féin gan taisteal ar chor ar bith chuig an tír eile
You are a cross-border commuter (also known as a cross-border or frontier worker) if you live in one EU country but work in another and you go home at least once a week
Is comaitéir trasteorainn thú má chónaíonn tú i dtír amháin den AE agus má oibríonn tú i gceann eile ach má fhilleann tú ar an mbaile ar a laghad uair sa tseachtain

As a cross-border worker, you must be treated in the same way as an employee who is a national of the country of employment as regards the right to apply for jobs, working conditions and social benefits

Mar oibrí trasteorainn ní mór caitheamh leat ar an mbealach céanna le fostaí gur saoránach den tír ina bhfuil sé/sí fostaithe maidir le cearta iarratais a dhéanamh ar phostanna, coinníollacha oibre agus sochair shóisialta

Therefore, the general rule is that you pay social security contributions in the member state where you are employed and you are subject to the legislation of that state even if you live in another member state
Mar sin, go ginearálta íocann tú ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh leis an mballstát ina bhfuil tú fostaithe agus baineann an reachtaíocht sa stát sin leat fiú má chónaíonn tú i mballstát eile
With regard to benefits, generally you get short-term benefits from the state where you last paid insurance and long-term benefits proportionately from all the countries in which you paid insurance

Maidir le sochair, go ginearálta faigheann tú sochair ghearr-théarmacha ón Stát inár íoc tú árachas go deireanach agus sochair fhad-théarmacha i gcomhréir ó na tíortha uilig ina raibh tú ag íoc árachais iontu
For cross-border workers, the rule in relation to unemployment benefit is as follows:
Seo a leanas na rialacha a bhaineann le sochair dífhostaíochta do chomaitéirí trasteorainn:
• During partial or intermittent unemployment you get your benefit from the country of employment
• Más tréimhse dífhostaíochta páirt-aimseartha nó sealadach atá i gceist íocann an tír ina bhfuil tú ag obair inti sochar dífhostaíochta leat
• During periods of being wholly unemployed, you get your benefit from the country of residence
• Más tréimhse dífhostaithe fadthéarmach atá i gceist íocann an tír ina chónaíonn tú sochar dífhostaíochta leat
So, for example, if you are living in the State and working in Northern Ireland you can claim Jobseeker’s Benefit from your local social welfare office or Intreo centre, if you lose your job

Mar shampla, má tá tú i do chónaí sa Stát, ag obair i dTuaisceart na hÉireann agus má chailleann tú do phost, is féidir iarratas ar Shochar Cuardaitheora Poist do d’oifig leasa shóisialaigh áitiúil nó d’ionad Intreo a dhéanamh
If you are employed or self-employed in 2 member states, you pay social security contributions in the state where you live
Má tá tú fostaithe nó féin-fhostaithe i 2 bhallstáit, is féidir leat ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh a íoc sa tír ina bhfuil cónaí ort inti
The Border People website is a source of information for people living in the border counties of Ireland and elsewhere in the island of Ireland
Is an suíomh gréasáin Border People é foinse faisnéise do dhaoine atá ina gcónaí sna contaetha trasteorann na hÉireann agus in áit eile san oileán Éireann
It provides cross-border mobility information on taxation, social security and job seeking, health and education as well as banking, housing and telecommunications
Soláthraíonn sé faisnéis soghluaisteachta trasteorann maidir le cáin, slándáil shóisialach agus lorg oibre, sláinte agus oideachas, chomh maith le baincéireacht, tithíocht agus teileachumarsáide
The information is about rights and entitlements in Northern Ireland and Ireland with sections about living, working and studying both north and south of the border
Tá an fhaisnéis le haghaidh cearta agus teidlíochtaí i dTuaisceart Éireann agus in Éirinn agus tá rannáin maidir le cónaí, obair agus staidéir sa tuaisceart agus sa deisceart an teorainn
There is also a list of frequently asked questions on topics such as motoring, employment, tax, healthcare, consumer and social welfare
Tá liosta ceisteanna coitianta freisin faoi ábhair, mar shampla, gluaisteánaíocht, fostaíocht, cáin, cúram sláinte, tomhaltóirí agus leas sóisialach
For information about your rights in the European Union you can contact:
Chun faisnéis faoi do chearta san AE a fháil, is féidir dul i dteagmháil le:
European Commission Representation in Ireland
Oifig an Choimisiúin Eorpaigh in Éirinn
You are a posted worker if your employer sends you to work in another country on a temporary basis
Má chuireann d’fhostóir in Éirinn thú ag obair go sealadach i dtír eile den LEE, tugtar oibrí sannta ort
The period of the posting is a maximum period of 24 months
Tá an tréimhse sannta suas le 24 mhí (12 mhí roimhe seo)
If you are posted to another EEA state or Switzerland you have certain rights as follows:
Má shanntar chuig tír eile den LEE nó Eilvéis tá teidlíochtaí áirithe agat mar a leanas:
As a posted worker you generally will continue to pay your social security contributions in Ireland
Má oibrí sannta thú, de ghnáth leanfaidh tú do chuid ranníocaíochtaí slándála sóisialaí in Éirinn a íoc
You should apply for an A1 (formerly E101) certificate which states that you are insured for social security purposes in Ireland
Ba chóir duit iarratas a dhéanamh ar theastas A1 (E101 roimhe seo) a sonraíonn go bhfuil tú clúdaithe faoi árachas sóisialach in Éirinn
This will exempt you and your employer from paying social insurance in the country to which you are posted
Beidh tú agus d’fhostóír díolmhaithe ó árachas sóisialach a íoc sa tír in atá tú sannta
At least 4 weeks before you leave you or your employer should apply for the AI certificate
Caithfidh tú ó d’fhostóir iarratas a dhéanamh ar theastas A1 4 seachtain roimh d’imeacht ar a laghad
You can download the application form for an A1 (pdf) and it is also available from the PRSI Special Collections Section of the Department of Social Protection (DSP)
Tá an fhoirm iarratais ar fáil anseo (pdf) agus ón Rannóg Bailithe Speisialta ÁSPC den Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí (RCS)
When you get the A1 certificate you will continue to pay your PRSI contributions in Ireland
Nuair a fhaigheann tú an teastas A1, leanfaidh tú do ranníocaíochtaí ÁSPC in Éirinn a íoc
There are further details about PRSI and posted workers on the DSP website
Tá níos mó sonraí faoi oibrithe sannta agus ÁSPC ar an suíomh gréasáin RCS
The European Health Insurance Card (EHIC) replaced forms such as the E111 and the E128, making it easier for you to get medical care quickly and easily
Tháinig Cárta Eorpach Árachas Sláinte (CEAS) in ionad an E111 agus an E128 agus cóir leighis le fáil thapa na córa leighis a éascú duit
It is evidence that you are part of a health insurance scheme administered by another state in the EEA/Switzerland
B’fhianaise í gur bhall de scéim árachais sláinte tú atá á riar ag stát éigin eile sa LEE nó Eilvéis
An S1 portable document (formerly E106) ensures that you have the same health entitlements in the state to which you are being posted, as are available to nationals of that state
Áiritheoidh an S1 doiciméad iniompartha (E106 roimhe seo) go mbeidh na teidlíochtaí céanna agat sa stát ina seoltar thú, mar atá ar fáil do náisiúnach den stát sin
Before you go to another EU state, you should contact your Local Health Office to obtain an S1
Sula dtéann tú go stát AE eile, ba chóir duit dul i dteagmháil le d'Oifig Áitiúil Sláinte chun S1 a fháil
